body:
The most straightforward way to do this is directly:

char z = (zBits[7]     ) |
         (zBits[6] << 1) |
         (zBits[5] << 2) |
         (zBits[4] << 3) |
         (zBits[3] << 4) |
         (zBits[2] << 5) |
         (zBits[1] << 6) |
         (zBits[0] << 7);

If you like, you can reformulate this into a loop which will be slightly shorter.
title: c++ - Convert an int array of 8 positions to char
